titleStmt.title: Unknown date: Octavius Hadfield to unknown person

sourceDesc.p: Wellington City Libraries book of typed transcriptions, spine title "Hadfield, Typescript Miscellaneous Fragments 1833-1897", stamped 19 Dec 1979. Section: Fragments - Fragmentary extracts from the letters of Octavius Hadfield. "EXTRACT NO. 8." Page 26.
Re-typed and encoded into TEI by Melissa Bryant, 10.12.15

front.p: Unknown date: Octavius Hadfield to unknown person

body.p: Then I went to take the Petition to the Queen containing the names of Ngatiana , that ---------? and those with him might see it. I read it aloud to them. Afterwards I said Eruiua do you approve of what is contained in this Petition? He replied that he did. I asked are you willing to attach your name to this Petition? He replied I am. I said to him hold the pen- His hand held the pen- I then wrote his name. And so with reference to Matioro. I enquired of him, he assented and I held the pen. Their two names were written -- these names attached to seal the Petition. These are the names of the who saw them sign their names.
